alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 3:13AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Laurel, north central Knox, southwestern Jackson and southwestern Clay Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 313 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sasser, or 8 miles southwest of Manchester, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fletcher and Cranes Nest around 320 AM EDT. Sprule, Pigeonroost, Sibert, Herron, Hima and Jarvis around 325 AM EDT. Cottongin, Jonsee, Woollum, Park Valley, Haven, House, Fount, Bluehole, Green Road and Horse Creek Junction around 330 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Goose Rock, Boho, Ogle, Lipps, Hammond, Salt Gum, Botto, Plank and Barnyard. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 33 and 48. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 2 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
